intro: Heptapleurum kavaiense, commonly known as Kavaiense stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of the Philippines and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, often on cliffs or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
